    • Constructor Detail

      • PersistentObjectStorage

        public PersistentObjectStorage(java.lang.String directoryName)
        Before you use any other method of this library you have to set a storage path. The storage path is always a directory with directoryName which will be created in the home path of the current user. directoryName gets trimmed.
        Parameters:
        directoryName - The name of the directory inside the home directory of the current user where all files are created and read with this library.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If directoryName is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If directoryName is empty

    • Method Detail

      • getStoragePath

        public java.lang.String getStoragePath()
        Get the current set storage path as a String.
        Returns:
        Current set storage path

      • isFirstStart

        public boolean isFirstStart()
        Checks if the file notFirstStart exists, so you can check if the application was started once before.
        Returns:
        True if file notFirstStart doesn't exist in the storage path

      • firstStartFinished

        public void firstStartFinished()
                        throws java.io.IOException
        If called, an empty file notFirstStart is created in the storage path. From now on isFirstStart returns false.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurred

      • resetFirstStart

        public boolean resetFirstStart()
        Deletes the file notFirstStart in the storage path if it exists. From now on isFirstStart returns true.
        Returns:
        True if notFirstStart file existed and was successfully deleted, else false

      • read

        public <T extends java.io.Serializable> T read(java.lang.String fileName)
                                        throws java.io.IOException,
                                               java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Reads an object of a given type from a File.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the object that is read
        Parameters:
        fileName - The name of the file an object should be read from
        Returns:
        Object of a given type
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If fileName is null
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - If the file does not exist, is a directory rather than a regular file, or for some other reason cannot be opened for reading.
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurred
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - Class of a serialized object cannot be found
        java.io.InvalidClassException - Something is wrong with a class used by serialization
        java.io.StreamCorruptedException - Control information in the stream is inconsistent
        java.io.OptionalDataException - Primitive data was found in the stream instead of objects
        java.lang.ClassCastException - If wrong class for T is given

      • write

        public <T extends java.io.Serializable> void write(T object,
                                                   java.lang.String fileName)
                                            throws java.io.IOException
        Writes an object of a given type to a File.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the object that is written
        Parameters:
        object - The object of a given type that should be written
        fileName - The name of the File the object should be written to
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If fileName is null
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - If the file exists but is a directory rather than a regular file, does not exist but cannot be created, or cannot be opened for any other reason
        java.io.InvalidClassException - Something is wrong with a class used by serialization
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurred

      • resetAllData

        public void resetAllData()
        Deletes the directory where all files created with this library are stored. From now on isFirstStart returns true.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
